Should I prefix? (Last updated: Tue Feb 19 16:04:04 +0100 2013)

(What) Should I prefix?

Sometimes it is hard to remember what CSS properties to prefix. Not all prefixes are always needed and things often change. CSS Preprocessors and their mixin libraries are not always up to date (and sometimes you dont need them).

This page has one purpose: simply show what prefixes are needed for a CSS property. If you need more information: I’ve linked to the awesome caniuse.com and html5please (from which I took most of the info actually).

Show Prefixed Show Prefixless Show All

  • transforms

    Method of transforming an element including rotating, scaling, etc. 

    
	.example {
	  -webkit-transform: rotate(30deg);
	     -moz-transform: rotate(30deg);
	      -ms-transform: rotate(30deg);
	          transform: rotate(30deg);
	}
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this true

  • text-shadow

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		text-shadow
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • text-overflow

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		text-overflow

    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • multicolumn

    Method of flowing information in multiple columns 

    
	.example {
	  -webkit-column-count: 2;
	     -moz-column-count: 2;
	          column-count: 2;

	  -webkit-column-gap: 10px; 
	     -moz-column-gap: 10px;  
	          column-gap: 10px; 

	  -webkit-column-rule: 1px solid #000;
	     -moz-column-rule: 1px solid #000;
	          column-rule: 1px solid #000;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice Edit this true

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		min-width
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • masks

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		masks
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • hyphens

    Method of controlling when words at the end of lines should be hyphenated using the "hyphens" property. 

    
	.example {
	  /* From: http://vlst.nl/x/e2 */
	  -ms-word-break: break-all;
	      word-break: break-all;

	       /* Non standard for webkit */
	       word-break: break-word;

	  -webkit-hyphens: auto;
	     -moz-hyphens: auto;
	          hyphens: auto;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice Edit this true

  • grids

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		grids
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • gradients

    Method of defining a linear or radial color gradient as a CSS image. 

    
	.example {
	  background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top,       #333 0%,#EEE 100%);
	  background:    -moz-linear-gradient(top,       #333 0%,#EEE 100%);
	  background:      -o-linear-gradient(top,       #333 0%,#EEE 100%);
	  background:         linear-gradient(to bottom, #333 0%,#EEE 100%);
	}
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this true

  • font-feature-settings

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		font-feature-settings
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • font-face

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		font-face
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • flexbox

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		flexbox
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • filters

    Method of applying filter effects (like blur, grayscale, brightness, contrast and hue) to elements, previously only possible by using SVG. 

    
	.example {
	  -webkit-filter: grayscale(50%);
	          filter: grayscale(50%);
	}
    Browser support Usage advice Edit this true

  • exclusions

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		exclusions
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • css3-colors

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		css3-colors
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • calc

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		calc
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • box-sizing

    Method of specifying whether or not an element's borders and padding should be included in size units 

    
	.example {
	  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	     -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	          box-sizing: border-box;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice Edit this true

  • box-shadow

    Method of displaying an inner or outer shadow effect to elements 

    
	.example {
	  ...
	  box-shadow: 3px 3px 0 #000;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • box-reflection

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		box-reflection
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • border-radius

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		border-radius
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • border-image

    Method of using images for borders 

    
	.example {
	  -webkit-border-image: url(img.png) 10px / 20px round;
	     -moz-border-image: url(img.png) 10px / 20px round;
	       -o-border-image: url(img.png) 10px / 20px round;
	          border-image: url(img.png) 10px / 20px round;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this true

  • background-image-options

    Description: of this CSS feature 

    
		background-image-options
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this false

  • Animations

    Complex method of animating certain properties of an element 

    
	@-webkit-keyframes MyAnimation {
	    0% { left: 0; }	
	   50% { left: 200px; }	
	  100% { left: 20px; }	
	}
	@keyframes MyAnimation {
	    0% { left: 0; }	
	   50% { left: 200px; }	
	  100% { left: 20px; }	
	}

	.example.is-animating {
	  ...
	  -webkit-animation: MyAnimation 2s;
	          animation: MyAnimation 2s;
	}
    Browser support Usage advice More info Edit this true
